subject: Photography
title: Selective Attention in Vision
description: One-minute skill: Selective Attention in Vision.

hook.text: You're watching a street performer and miss the pickpocket behind you. Your eyes saw everything. Your brain didn't.

buildup.text: Human vision is selective. The brain filters out most visual information, focusing on what it deems important.

discovery.text: Inattentional blindness means you can look directly at something and not see it if your attention is elsewhere.

twist.text: Cameras have no selective attention. They record everything equally â€” the subject and the distracting background.

climax.text: Great photographers learn to see what the camera sees â€” not what their brain edits. That awareness changes everything.

punchline.text: You see what you focus on. The camera sees it all.

quiz.question: What is inattentional blindness?
options: Failing to notice visible things because your attention is focused elsewhere
The inability to see in low light
